programme.title: Kencho-ji, Japan

programme.title: Savoy Castle, Aosta Valley, Italy
programme.desc: Just outside Gressoney-Saint-Jean, a little mountain village in the Aosta Valley in Italy, is Queen Margherita&apos s fairy tale summer residence: the Savoy Castle. Like in any fairytale, the turrets of this early 20th century dwelling emerge from the surrounding woodland. Thanks to Margherita of Savoy, spouse of Umberto I and Queen of Italy, between the end of the 19th and the beginning of the 20th century, Gressoney became one of the favorite holiday localities to be frequented by the nobility.

programme.title: Ruins of Bridgettine Convent
programme.desc: The ruins rising above the Pirita River banks date back to 1407, when the largest nunnery in Old Livonia was founded here. The convent that got its name from St. Birgitta, who founded the mother convent in Sweden, survived in its original form until 1577 "& "when Ivan the Terrible destroyed it. At the end of the last century, several extensive excavation and conservation projects took place on the medieval convent premises. The massive faade, walls, cellars, and graveyard have survived until the present.

programme.title: Trapezitsa Fortress
programme.desc: The fortress on Trapezitsa was built somewhere in XIII century and during the Second Bulgarian kingdom there were housed the main church buildings of the capital city, the Patriarchate and the Patriarch`s residence. In the past, the high walls of the fort"& "ification were rising on the steep rocks.

programme.title: Mar Saba Monastery, Palestinian Territories
programme.desc: The Holy Lavra of Saint Sabbas, known in Syriac as Mar Saba, is a Greek Orthodox monastery overlooking the Kidron Valley at a point halfway between the Old City of Jerusalem and the Dead Sea, within the Bethlehem Governorate of the West Bank.

programme.title: The Good Samaritan Museum
programme.desc: On the road from Jerusalem to the Dead Sea, discover the Good Samaritain Museum, an archaeological and historical site. This museum, which is the only mosaic museum in the country and one of only three in the world, has artefacts which were unearthed in J"& "udea, Samaria and Gaza on display. You are in the area of Ma'ale Adumim (Red Heights), on the same road that pilgrims used to take on their way to Jerusalem, particularly those coming from the Galilee via the Jordan Valley and Jericho, in the footsteps of"& " Jesus and John the Baptist

programme.title: Roman Catholic Church of the Name of Mary, Serbia
programme.desc: The Church of the Name of Mary is a Roman Catholic church from 1893-4. It replaces an old church from the 18th century, damaged during the Serbian uprising of 1849. The faade of this new neo-gothic church is made of yellow brick.

programme.title: Tristana
programme.desc: When the young woman Tristana's mother dies, she is entrusted to the guardianship of the well-respected though old Don Lope. Don Lope is well-liked and well-known because of his honorable nature, despite his socialistic views about business and religion. But Don Lope's one weakness is women, and he falls for the innocent girl in his charge, seduces her, makes her his lover, though all the while explaining to her that she is as free as he. But when she acts on this freedom, Don Lope must deal with the consequences of his world-view.

programme.title: Under Capricorn
programme.desc: In 1831, Irishman Charles Adare travels to Australia to start a new life with the help of his cousin who has just been appointed governor. When he arrives he meets powerful landowner and ex-convict Sam Flusky, who wants to do a business deal with him. Whilst attending a dinner party at Flusky's house, Charles meets Flusky's wife Henrietta who he had known as a child back in Ireland. Henrietta is an alcoholic and seems to be on the verge of madness.

programme.title: Voyage To The Prehistoric Planet
programme.desc: In 2020, after the colonization of the moon, the spaceships Vega, Sirius and Capella are launched from Lunar Station 7. They are to explore Venus under the command of Professor Hartman, but an asteroid collides and explodes Capella.
